es.utils.mapper.converter

Class AbstractConverter<IN,OUT>

  • java.lang.Object
    • es.utils.mapper.impl.MapperObject<T,U>
      • es.utils.mapper.impl.object.DirectMapper<IN,OUT>
        • es.utils.mapper.converter.AbstractConverter<IN,OUT>
  • Type Parameters:
    IN - type of the object to convert
    OUT - type of the object converted

    public abstract class AbstractConverter<IN,OUT>
extends DirectMapper<IN,OUT>
    This class is used to specify a converter over a single field in a mapping inside the Converter annotation.
    Your custom converter must have a empty constructor that will be used to instantiate your converter.
    The converter is apply if specified in the Converter annotation of the origin field or (if not found) on the destination field

    Example of AbstractConverter that convert a Timestamp into a Date: 
    public class ConverterDateTimestamp extends AbstractConverter<Date,Timestamp> {
    public ConverterDateTimestamp() {
        super(Date.class, Timestamp.class, date->new Timestamp(date.getTime()));
    }
}
    And on the field to be mapped: 
    @Converter(ConverterDateTimestamp.class)
    Author:
    eschoysman
    See Also:
    Converter

    • Constructor Detail

      • AbstractConverter

        protected AbstractConverter(Class<IN> from,
                            Class<OUT> to)
        Create a DirectMapper from type from to type to with no transformation. The conversion is done calling the abstract method convert.
        Parameters:
        from - source type
        to - destination type

        Parameters:

        Returns:
